name: Cape of Lores
role_in_state: primary headland relay for coastal trade and ritual auguries
culture_adjustments: stronger cult of winds and wreck-lore tied to promontory features
seasonal navigation calendar centered on cape wind-leaps
promontory clans control landing strips and augury shrines (more oligarchic)
greater suspicion of inland merchants; emphasis on local maritime autonomy
constraints: ritual magic dependent on scarce imported reagents
combustion industry limited by tech baseline
notes: important relay for state coastal calendars and pilot training
cape auguries enhance navigation but never replace charts or seamanship
